adjective.description: Entomology. Of a plant gall: having only one chamber. rare.
Zoology. Of an animal or protist: having a shell, test, or skeleton with a single chamber.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in William Kirby (1759–1850), entomologist and naturalist. From mono- + scientific Latin thalamus or its etymon ancient Greek θάλαμος inner chamber + -ous. In sense 2 after French monothalame.
